conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each source and how the baffles will direct the flow.
Liquid from A will flow downwards and hit the black baffle.
The black baffle is angled towards the left.
The liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow downwards and hit the black baffle.
Similar to A, the black baffle will direct the liquid towards the left.
The liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow downwards and hit the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle is angled towards the right.
The liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow downwards and hit the gray baffle.
The gray baffle is angled towards the right.
The liquid from D will flow into container G.
Liquid from sources A and B will flow into container E; liquid from sources C and D will flow into container G.
